com.akamon.api.client.net

Class QueryStringBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.akamon.api.client.net.QueryStringBuilder

  • public class QueryStringBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to manage and generate the query string part of an URL.

        QueryStringBuilder builder = new QueryStringBuilder("/test.jsp")
        .addQueryParameter("english", "hello world")
        .addQueryParameter("german", "gruezi");
    String query = builder.encode();
    returns "/test.jsp?english=hello%20world&german=gruezi"

    Dependendies

    • Apache commons-httpclient, 3.1
    Author:
    Vladimir Ritz Bossicard

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ENCODING

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_ENCODING
        Default encoding used when no encoding is defined as parameter. The encoding is retrieved via Charset.defaultCharset().name().

      • QueryStringBuilder

        public QueryStringBuilder(java.lang.String spec)
        Creates a QueryStringBuilder from the String representation.

        This constructor is equivalent to a call to the three-arguments constructor with a spec, null and true arguments.

        Parameters:
        spec - the String to parse.
        See Also:
        QueryStringBuilder(String, String, boolean)

      • QueryStringBuilder

        public QueryStringBuilder(java.lang.String spec,
                  boolean override)
        Creates a QueryStringBuilder from the String representation with automatic overriding of the parameters.

        This constructor is equivalent to a call to the three-arguments constructor with a spec, DEFAULT_ENCODING and override arguments.

        Parameters:
        spec - the String to parse.
        override - true if already defined parameters will be overridden by newly defined ones.
        See Also:
        QueryStringBuilder(String, String, boolean)

      • QueryStringBuilder

        public QueryStringBuilder(java.lang.String spec,
                  java.lang.String enc,
                  boolean override)
        Creates a QueryStringBuilder from the String representation with automatic overriding of the parameters.

        The string will be parsed and the query parameters will be decoded and added to the list of parameters.

        Parameters:
        spec - the String to parse.
        enc - The name of a supported character encoding
        override - true if already defined parameters will be overridden by newly defined ones.

    • Method Detail

      • getBase

        public java.lang.String getBase()
        Returns the base of the URL.

      • addQueryParameter

        public QueryStringBuilder addQueryParameter(NameValuePair param)
        Adds a parameter to the list of already defined parameters. Already existing parameters are overridden depending on the how the QueryStringBuilder object was created.
        Parameters:
        param - the parameter to add.
        See Also:
        QueryStringBuilder(String, String, boolean), QueryStringBuilder(String, boolean)

      • addQueryParameter

        public QueryStringBuilder addQueryParameter(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.Object value,
                                   java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Adds a parameter to the list of already defined parameters. Already existing parameters are overridden depending on the how the QueryStringBuilder object was created.

        A value is considered as invalid if it is:

        • null values
        • empty values
        • blank values
        Parameters with invalid values will not be added.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter
        value - the value of the parameter. The toString method will be invoked to retrieve the parameter's real value.
        defaultValue - the default value used in case the passed value argument is considered as invalid.
        See Also:
        addQueryParameter(NameValuePair)

      • addQueryParameter

        public QueryStringBuilder addQueryParameter(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String value)
        Invokes addQueryParameter(String, Object, String) with a null defaultValue. #see addQueryParameter(String, Object, String)

        Returns the encoded URL String.

        Throws:
